title: Favourite (big) metal band
content:
Rorie did it before and I'm in the mood to try it again.
A little explanation may be necessary:
Due to the limited poll possibilities I had to select only the biggest metal bands (in Europe) for this selection. If you think one of your bands is not included then it's because your band is not big enough (Megadeth, Iced Earth, etc.) or I don't consider them as metal enough (Guns N' Roses, Rammstein, Slipknot, System of a down). I replaced Slayer on the last moment with Nightwish because I don't expect them to get a vote anyway.

Also, don't take that metal enough reason to serious, I used to get a small selection of bands.

On a last note; I know some of you don't like metal, that's all right with me but you don't need to post about it. -----------------
[img]http://www.jamba.nl/storage/view/335/0/sn/Snow_Ball.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.com/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img]
Jamster! rules!

title: haha
content: Xky knows nothing about bands, but I heard some Megadeth (Megadeath?) once, and it seemed pretty funny. Reminded me of the music in F-Zero X on the N64... and I enjoyed that game's music, even if it was trashy wannabe metal. Or something.

title: Re: Favourite (big) metal band
content:

Reminded me of the music in F-Zero X on the N64... and I enjoyed that game's music, even if it was trashy wannabe metal. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Or something. [hr][/quote]
It's really Megadeth. And they are thrashy not trashy and wannabe [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] You know they did the Duke3d soundtrack?

Xtraverse I wonder would Slayer have been your favourite out of these bands?-----------------

title: Re: Favourite (big) metal band
content:
\m/ Maiden of course!

Iced Earth are really good, but are not my favorite band, even though Ive seen them twice in concert haha. I dont really like their new album. Ripper Ownens doesnt replace Matt Barlow.[img]http://www.denness.net/rpi/username/mr12000[/img]

title: Re: Favourite (big) metal band
content:
You saw Iced Earth with Barlow? You lucky ******! I had the opportunity to see them once on their 'completely cancelled except for two dates' European tour. In my opinion Ripper is a dreadful singer I can't listen neither to the latest Iced Earth album nor to his past Judas Priest albums. The guitar riffs are also becoming more and more simple so I have to agree with you here.-----------------
[img]http://www.geocities.com/anthalerero/pic/banner_eurovision.jpg[/img]

title: Re: Favourite (big) metal band
content:
Yeah he bothers me. Sounds too much like Halford and I dont care for him. Also the super "all american kick ass fucl yeah bomb some terrorist!" attitude really kinda put me off. "When the eeeeeagle cries!!!!!"

Acutally I have the bands autograph, including Barlows! hahaha I got to talk to them. I was lucky because it was my birthday and Jon Schaffer's brother was behind me at the show and thought it was cool that I was diggin it, so he introduced me. I met all of them except Jon himself very breifly... I didnt have many words. I was a real big fan at the time. Im not so much anymore. But yeah! I was stoked! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [img]http://www.denness.net/rpi/username/mr12000[/img]

title: Re: Favourite (big) metal band
content:
I disagree with him sounding like Halford, Halford sings more natural while I get the impression that Tim has to force his voice. To bad you don't care for him, Judas Priest is (once you get used to them) one of the best metal bands out there. But at least you're the first American who 'knows' Maiden.-----------------
[img]http://www.geocities.com/anthalerero/pic/banner_eurovision.jpg[/img]

title: Re: Favourite (big) metal band
content:
No I like Halford, I dont like Owens in Iced Earth.

And tons of Americans love Maiden. Ive seen a dozen Iron Maiden shirts at my school.[img]http://www.denness.net/rpi/username/mr12000[/img]
